posts.post_content: I don't know why you think this isn't better than [naturalize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=naturalize). You just pointed out that it saves you the mana AND it'll pull threat off that [Lurking Predators](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lurking Predators) you wanna play later. They'll pop your seal so yo don't pop their enchantment with it then you drop the predators once they wasted their side-decked 2-of naturalize. It has utility and mind games to it, making it better than some stupid Jund naturalize turn cards sideways boring standard play. 4/5 only because it stole its glory from [Seal of Cleansing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seal of Cleansing) the same way [Naturalize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Naturalize) stole its glory from [Disenchant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Disenchant).

posts.post_content:
[Verduran Enchantress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Verduran Enchantress) and [Mesa Enchantress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mesa Enchantress) are why you would use this over Disenchant/Naturalize. With [Skull of Orm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skull of Orm) you can infinite destroy enchant/artifact.  
  
Clearly its not strictly better or worse, but it has its purpose.

Posted By: Mudbutt_on (1/13/2011 11:47:12 PM)

posts.post_content:
I don't understand why some people prefer this to [naturalize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=naturalize). As far as i can tell, the seal has two things going for it: you can spend the mana whenever you have it available instead of when you actually use it, and it can have enchantment related synergy (dowsing shaman, sigil of the empty throne, whatever.) But just for answering artifacts and enchantments, naturalize is first of all an instant (sure, you can activate the seal as an instant, but only after you've cast it at sorcery speed.) Also, if your opponent has an important artifact or enchantment, before they play it, they can destroy the seal with their *own* naturalize or seal or whatever.  
  
and in any case [krosan grip](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=krosan grip) is much better, and i personally would prefer some card advantage like [mystic melting](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mystic melting), [filigree fracture](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=filigree fracture) or [acidic slime](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=acidic slime).  
  
edit: I mean simply as far as removing artifacts/enchantments, any other synerg... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I don't understand why some people prefer this to naturalize. As far as i can tell, the seal has two things going for it: you can spend the mana whenever you have it available instead of when you actually use it, and it can have enchantment related synergy (dowsing shaman, sigil of the empty throne, whatever.) But just for answering artifacts and enchantments, naturalize is first of all an instant (sure, you can activate the seal as an instant, but only after you've cast it at sorcery speed.) Also, if your opponent has an important artifact or enchantment, before they play it, they can destroy the seal with their own naturalize or seal or whatever.

and in any case krosan grip is much better, and i personally would prefer some card advantage like mystic melting, filigree fracture or acidic slime.

edit: I mean simply as far as removing artifacts/enchantments, any other synerg... (see all)
